column4: If I want to sync up my work and home computer, can I just have them rsync my /home directory?
what's a *safe* way to do that
especially since they're very different hardware
did you find unison conflicts a pain?
I used it for a while, but unison had strange conflicts always and it was like ugggh
haven't really run into it no, I usually run unison as soon as I startup so it just pulls my latest changes
I'm using it to sync my desktop and laptop
does it have rollback like subversion or other revision control?
not aware of such a thing.  I do know you can tell it to perform automatic backups
you don't have issues cause of diffferent hardware or anything like that?
no, but I spent a good deal of time choosing the right ignores at first.  I don't even use the same distro ;)
also, if I forget to sync before I leave home or leave work for the day....
but if you are just syncing your home, hardware shouldn't be an issue at all.  I can only think of a handful of files that you would have to ignore
